summary:
The Security Council,

Recalling resolution 1970 (2011) and subsequent resolutions on Libya,
Reaffirming commitment to Libya's sovereignty, independence, territorial integrity, and national unity,
Called on parties to armed conflict to protect civilians,
Recalled obligations under international humanitarian, human rights, and refugee law,
Welcomed efforts of UNSMIL and the Special Representative to facilitate a Libyan-led political solution,
Recognized the need for assistance planning for a Government of National Accord and security arrangements,
Welcomed the initialling of the Libyan Political Agreement of Skhirat, Morocco on 11 July 2015,
Urged full, equal, and effective participation of women in democratic transition, conflict resolution, and peacebuilding,
Welcomed efforts of participants in the UN-facilitated Libyan Political Dialogue,
Expressed concern at terrorist groups in Libya, including ISIL, and their negative impact,
Reaffirmed the need to combat terrorist threats,
Expressed concern at unsecured arms and ammunition in Libya,
Reaffirmed accountability for human rights violations and abuses,
Recalled referral of the situation in Libya to the ICC,
Noted decisions on arms embargo, travel ban, assets freeze, and measures concerning illicit oil exports,
Encouraged Libyan authorities to increase transparency of government revenues and expenditures,
Emphasized respect for international humanitarian law and UN guiding principles of humanitarian emergency assistance,
Took note of the report of the Secretary-General on UNSMIL (S/2015/624).
Here is a summarized version of the Security Council document:

The Security Council:

Noting the special report of the Secretary-General on the strategic assessment of the UN presence in Libya and the final report of the Panel of Experts, 

Recalling its determination that the situation in Libya constitutes a threat to international peace and security,
